text: The Chapel of S. Saviour is the chapel to Ardingly College in West Sussex, England, and is considered an example of Gothic Revival architecture. The chapel was designed by R.H Carpenter and William Slater. The foundation stone of the college chapel was laid in 1864 and finished in 1892https://historicengland.org.uk/listing/the-list/list-entry/1354803 The chapel was dedicated to St Saviour, and built predominantly of brick. It is a Grade II listed building.Letts, S; Ardingly: Its Building and Buildings. Old Ardinians Society (1985) The current chaplain is Fr Adrian Stark-Ordish. ==References== Category:Churches completed in 1892 Category:Buildings and structures in West Sussex Category:Grade II listed buildings in West Sussex Category:University and college chapels in the United Kingdom Category:Ardingly
title: Ardingly College Chapel
